title: Chicken Soup for the Cthulhian Soul
description:
It's easiest to just start out with the bad and get  it out of the way.
CONS: Eldritch Horror is big, clunky, and fiddly. I've owned this game for years, and to the best of my memory I don't think I've ever played a game without referencing the rulebook at least once, if not repeatedly. It takes ages to set up and tear down. It takes several hours to play, so make sure you carve out a big chunk of your day before even trying. And lastly, I highly recommend buying the base game WITH the Forsaken Lore small-box expansion, which fleshes out the base game incredibly well.

PROS: Just about everything else. If you want a big, meaty, hard Eldritch experience, this is an outstanding place to get it. Personally, I'm not much of a long-term planner. I love playing games by the seat of my pants and going with my gut instinct. With that in mind, I have lost this game more often than I've won. But losing has never felt cheap or lame or anticlimactic. It's a struggle from the very outset as the game can be very difficult. It punishes mistakes harshly, and can equally punish inaction. And sometimes it punishes you for no reason at all. But even when the game pushes you right over the edge and the world goes up in flames, you had one hell of a wild ride to get there. And then when you do win, when you sneak in that last game-winning fight before the seams of reality splinter, victory is that much sweeter.

title: I love the...
description:
I love the theme and the adventure.But it's too long and heavy for my family. Solo was good but not great for the time invesment.

A bunch of components and rules, like the train/boat tickets, mythos phase and many kind of encounters bring theme to the table but also more randomness.

Mythos phase its like a set up for every round.

At the end feels like a giant puzzle more than an adventure to fight the ancient ones.

Would pray to Cthulhu for see this system in a cleaner and quicker fashion.

title: Streamline...
description:
Streamlined Arkham Horror? I must admit my first play of this went far longer than I would have thought possible... but am willing to give this +many+ more chances.

I expect my rating of this to rise over time.

[b]UPDATE:[/b] This is still a long game. While it's not as lengthy as Arkham Horror is, it's deceptively long... which isn't necessarily a bad thing. What's far more important is that it's an enjoyable experience -- even if damned frustrating at times.

Have had heads handed to us every single time it hits the table -- and it doesn't matter. It's still fun!
